result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Donald R Haasl was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE will have a payment plan of $200.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022.
DE will have credit for 2 days, will have huber privilege.

Upon failure to pay, the Court may;

 Enter a civil judgment
 Intercept your income taxes
 Suspend your driving privilege on TR/CT cases
 Send debt to Department of Revenue.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald R Haasl

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
1:05 PM Defendant Donald R Haasl in court.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Donald R Haasl.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement into the court record.  DE will enter a plea to Ct 2. Ct's 1 and 3 will be DRI.  

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea of G, finds DE guilty. 

Argument entered by parties. 

Recommended sentence will be for a fine of $5500.00, $23.50 Restitution, 140 days jail, 30 month revocation of DL, 30 month IID, AODA assessment. Huber for Employment.  DE will report to jail today. Court will accept the recommended sentence.  2 days credit.  Adj 1:17pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:36 PM Defendant Donald R Haasl in court.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Donald R Haasl.  Attorney Annette Barna in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nussberger requesting a Plea/Sentencing date, agreement has been reached in this matter.  JA will find a date. Adj 2:05PM
